title: Records Pertaining to Flock Safety and the San Jose Police Department

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Records Pertaining to Flock Safety and the San Jose Police Department
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any emails, written communications, documents, contracts, presentations, or other communications between officials from the San Jose Police Department and officials from the company "Flock Safety."

I seek San Jose Police Department records of any kind, including electronic records, audiotapes, videotapes, and photographs, as well as letters, emails, facsimiles, telephone messages, voice mail messages and transcripts, notes, and minutes of any meetings. 

In the event some portions of the requested records are properly exempt from disclosure, please disclose any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions of the requested records. If it is your position that a document contains non-exempt segments, but that those non-exempt segments are so dispersed throughout the document as to make segregation impossible, please state what portion of the document is non-exempt, and how the material is dispersed throughout the document. If a request is denied in whole, please state specifically that it is not reasonable to segregate portions of the record for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

A. Nonymous

title: Unrivaled

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Unrivaled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records about the department's recruiting campaign, Unrivaled. VGCA (Very Good Creative Agency, LLC)

All documents, data collected pre- and post-campaign launch, PowerPoint or equivalent slides, assets including videos created in draft or final form, design mockups, and final designs. 

All in digital or physical format. Records should cover each part of the project and its deliverables, including findings, brand audits, SWOT analysis, other analysis findings in KPIs from the below categories

- Research and Discovery: market and consumer research, competitive analysis, strategic recommendations
- Strategy and Positioning: brand strategy development, market segmentation and targeting, positioning strategy, campaign planning and integrated strategies
- Concept and Create: creative concept development, message creation and copywriting, visual design and art direction
- Produce and activate: campaign production management, creative asset production, media production and placement, quality control and compliance, performance tracking and reporting
- Assess and optimize: data collection and analysis, audience targeting and personalization, campaign optimization, social media ad optimization, retargeting and remarking strategies

Invoices, contracts, payments, and agreements made by the ad agency or the department with vendors, influencers, trademark, and licensing of the LAPD name, anyone, and any company working externally to the department, purchases for ads, digital, and physical 

Please search 8/30/24 to today's date

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Your City of Los Angeles public records request #25-7310 has been closed.
communications.communication:
City of Los Angeles ************************************************************************ Record request #25-7310 has been closed. The closure reason supplied was: Dear Requester, The Department has completed its review of your request to the Los Angeles Police Department (“LAPD” or “Department”) under the California Public Records Act (Cal. Govt. Code section 7920.000, et seq., hereinafter the “CPRA” or “Act”) seeking the following records: “… records about the department's recruiting campaign, Unrivaled. VGCA (Very Good Creative Agency, LLC) 1-All documents, data collected pre- and post-campaign launch, PowerPoint or equivalent slides, assets including videos created in draft or final form, design mockups, and final designs. 2-All in digital or physical format. Records should cover each part of the project and its deliverables, including findings, brand audits, SWOT analysis, other analysis findings in KPIs from the below categories 3- Research and Discovery: market and consumer research, competitive analysis, strategic recommendations 4- Strategy and Positioning: brand strategy development, market segmentation and targeting, positioning strategy, campaign planning and integrated strategies 5-Concept and Create: creative concept development, message creation and copywriting, visual design and art direction 6- Produce and activate: campaign production management, creative asset production, media production and placement, quality control and compliance, performance tracking and reporting 7- Assess and optimize: data collection and analysis, audience targeting and personalization, campaign optimization, social media ad optimization, retargeting and remarking strategies 8-Invoices, contracts, payments, and agreements made by the ad agency or the department with vendors, influencers, trademark, and licensing of the LAPD name, anyone, and any company working externally to the department, purchases for ads, digital, and physical Please search 8/30/24 to today's date...” The Department is cognizant of its responsibilities under the Act. It recognizes the statutory scheme was enacted to maximize citizen access to the workings of government. The Act does not mandate disclosure of all documents within the government’s possession. Rather, by specific exemption and reference to other statutes, the Act recognizes that there are boundaries where the public’s right to access must be balanced against such weighty considerations as the right of privacy, a right of constitutional dimension under California Constitution, Article 1, Section 1. The law also exempts from disclosure records that are privileged or confidential or otherwise exempt under either express provisions of the Act or pursuant to applicable federal or state law, per California Government Code Sections 7927.200; 7927.700; 7923.600; 7927.705; and 7922.000. The Department has conducted a search and responds to your request as follows: To the extent that the Department has any records responsive to your request for items 1-7, these records remain privileged, confidential, and exempt from disclosure pursuant to the California Government Code Section 7922.000. Section 7922.000 permits the non-disclosure of such records and information when “the public interest served by not disclosing the record and/or information, clearly outweighs the public interest served by disclosure. The Department has a strong interest in maintaining the confidentiality of the records that consist of confidential information, deliberative, pre-decisional discussion and drafts. The disclosure of such records would undermine the Department’s ability to effectively achieve its objectives. Furthermore, Subsection 7.1 (E) of the City’s contract with the Very Good Creative Agency (VGCA), LLC, clearly states that “…Any reports, findings, deliverables, analyses, studies, notes, information, or data generated as a result of this Agreement are to be considered confidential…” As for item 8 on your request, to the extent that there are any records responsive to your request, for contracts and agreements, these records are available, published and can be accessed at the following links: https://ethics.lacity.gov/data/contracts/contracts/#dt https://clkrep.lacity.org/onlinecontracts/2024/C-145963_c_08-07-24.pdf https://www.lapdpolicecom.lacity.org/070924/BPC_24-145.pdf https://www.lapdpolicecom.lacity.org/032624/BPC_24-052.pdf In regard to the invoices related to your request, these records are available on the Office of the City Controller’s website, and can be accessed at the following link: https://lacity.spending.socrata.com/#!/year/2025/explore/0-/vendor_name/VERY+GOOD+CREATIVE+AGENCY+LLC/0-/government_activity/PROTECTION+OF+PERSONS+AND+PROPERTY/1/account_name If you have any questions, please respond to this email. Respectfully, LAPD Public Records & Subpoena Response Section, CPRA Unit ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Los Angeles.

Technical support: See our help page

title: James K. Roosevelt

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: James K. Roosevelt
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning or describing James "Jimmy" Roosevelt II (December 23, 1907 – August 13, 1991), including the pages identified as potentially responsive in FOIA 1348034-000. His death has been widely reported in the New York Times. See James Roosevelt, Ex-Congressman And a President's Son, Dies at 83 https://www.nytimes.com/1991/08/14/us/james-roosevelt-ex-congressman-and-a-president-s-son-dies-at-83.html and http://www.mcu.usmc.mil/historydivision/Pages/Who's%20Who/P-R/roosevelt_j.aspx

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have
    previously written
    about the government and its activities, with some reaching over 100,000
    readers in outlets such
    as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the People, Unicorn Riot, and
    The Outline,
    among others. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and
    my editorial and
    writing skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on
    the files online and
    make them available through non-profits such as the library Internet Archive
    and the journalist
    non-profit MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my
    research is not limited
    to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and
    attitudes of the government
    itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of
    this particular subject in
    advance.
    Further, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the
    released information to a
    broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch, Inc. v.
    Dep’t of Justice, 365
    F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of Justice, 19 F.
    3d 807, 814-15 (2d
    Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified because it also had
    “firm” plans to “publish a
    number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning United States foreign and
    national security policy."
    Under this criteria, as well, I qualify as a member of the news media.
    Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
    nature of the requester,
    not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made by” a
    representative of the news
    media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a
    representative of the
    news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for which
    he or she is requesting
    information." As such, the details of the request itself are moot for the
    purposes of determining
    the appropriate fee category.
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on it and making
    the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.
    This request specifically includes both previously processed and previously
    unprocessed
    documents. If the documents are 25 or more years old and previously
    processed documents were
    processed before the 25th anniversary of the document’s creation, I request
    that in addition to the
    previous processed copy, the document be reprocessed and redactions
    reviewed.

Documentation Files

# Deceased Individual

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix ARN SSN FBI Number Date of
Birth Place of Birth Date of Death Additional Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Records mentioning or describing James "Jimmy" Roosevelt II (December 23,
    1907 – August 13, 1991), including the pages identified as potentially
    responsive in FOIA 1348034-000. His death has been widely reported in the
    New York Times. See James Roosevelt, Ex-Congressman And a President's Son,
    Dies at 83
    https://www.nytimes.com/1991/08/14/us/james-roosevelt-ex-congressman-and-a-president-s-son-dies-at-83.html
    and
    http://www.mcu.usmc.mil/historydivision/Pages/Who's%20Who/P-R/roosevelt_j.aspx
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best
    
    Attachments:

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have
    previously
    written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over
    100,000
    readers in outlets such as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the
    People,
    Unicorn Riot, and The Outline, among others. As such, as I have a reasonable
    expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well
    established. In
    addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available
    through
    non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and the journalist
    non-profit MuckRock,
    disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to
    this, a great
    deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the
    government itself.
    As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this
    particular
    subject in advance.
    Further, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the
    released information
    to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch,
    Inc. v. Dep’t of
    Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of
    Justice, 19 F.
    3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified
    because it also
    had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning
    United States
    foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I
    qualify as a member of
    the news media.
    Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
    nature of the
    requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made
    by” a
    representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper
    reporter, for
    example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much
    interest there is
    in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the
    details of the
    request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee
    category.
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on it and
    making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

Documentation Files

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    The 5,996 pages considered potentially responsive to FOIA 1346536-000.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/77313/Fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?url_auth_token=AAAj2ProGzquHYFeb-SMkiAXsEc%3A1iUjSi%3AIrUZ_0BSRPDGxnplR6gf0S4JXVI&next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Ftemple-of-set-83197%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1346536-001
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 138 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 571 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,289 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,649 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
F: (540) 868-4391
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: California Police and Immigration (Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting records and data related to Senate Bill 674. The law requires certifying agencies that receive certification requests must annually report to the Legislature the number of victims that requested certifications from the particular agency, the number of certifications signed, and the number of certifications denied. The certifications are for U and T Visas. 

I am requesting 
- The annual reports sent to the legislature as legally required since 2018. 
- Department U visa certification policy and protocols since 2024
- Bulletins, emails, memos, directives, or any communications from DHS and/or United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) regarding SB674 and Form I-914s. Search January 2025 to today's date. 
- Any memos, bulletins, directives, or formal communications regarding U and T Visas. Search from 2020 to today's date. 

Thank you!

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=17570

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Death of Jack Borders (The University of New Mexico Office Of The Medical Examiner)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- any and all records pertaining to the May 2025 death of John (AKA Jack) Borders, a resident of Mountainair, NM
- any and all records pertaining to investigations involving John (AKA Jack) Borders, a resident of Mountainair, NM, as a suspect and/or witness
- any and all records of litigation naming John (AKA Jack) Borders, a resident of Mountainair, NM, as a party or witness

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Todd Brogowski

title: Request for Body Camera Footage and Incident Records – Feb 2, 2025 I-35 Chase (Bell County & Troy PD) (Temple Police Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Body Camera Footage and Incident Records – Feb 2, 2025 I-35 Chase (Bell County & Troy PD) (Temple Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the high-speed pursuit and arrests that occurred on February 2, 2025, beginning around 12:30 a.m. on Interstate 35 near the 310-mile marker in Troy, Texas. The incident involved two four-door vehicles reportedly traveling at 108 MPH. The first vehicle attempted to exit and re-enter the highway multiple times, then tried to drive northbound in the southbound lanes near Industrial Boulevard in Temple. Troy Police reportedly forced the vehicle off the road, and three suspects were arrested after a foot pursuit. Weapons and drugs were reportedly recovered.

Please include:

Body camera footage from Troy PD, Bell County SO, Temple PD, and Lorena PD

Dashcam video from all police units involved in the pursuit and apprehension

911 call audio and radio dispatch logs from the incident

Incident and arrest reports, including affidavits, if available

Any photos, drone, or scene video footage

Any use of force documentation (if applicable)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Chehalis Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Chehalis Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C226789-052325
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C226789-052325 received on May 23, 2025 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV25-C226789-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C226789-052325. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV25-C226789-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net)

  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
We have not prepared a detailed exemption log, as only limited information on a single document has been redacted from the responsive records. The information normally provided in an exemption log, such as title, author, recipient, subject, and number of pages, is readily ascertainable from looking at the redacted records. Redactions have been applied throughout the documents pursuant to the following exemption:   
 Ex. 01A Attorney-Client            Privileged Communications - RCW 42.56.070 and 5.60.060 Records reflect            communication between a client and an attorney for the purpose of seeking or            providing legal advice. 
The Legislative Department has now provided all responsive records. We consider your request closed and plan to take no further action to fulfill this request. If you have any follow-up questions or would like to initiate an administrative appeal under MDAR 17-0002 Section 6, please contact us within 10 business days after downloading your records, after which this request will no longer be monitored for communications. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Sincerely, 
Matt Jaeger 
(206) 684-8159 
Legislative Department

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Request to Marines for Personnel Record of Adam Driver

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to Marines for Personnel Record of Adam Driver
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the U.S. Marines Corps personnel records (OMPF) for a former servicemember named ADAM DOUGLAS DRIVER (DATE OF BIRTH: 11/19/1983). Mr. Driver was born in Fontana, California. He served in the U.S. Marines Corps from 2001 to 2004 and achieved the rank of lance corporal. The requested records include performance reports, job assessments, disciplinary records, training received, discharge papers, and any other releasable records.

I originally submitted this request to the National Personnel Records Center, which ordinarily handles these requests, but they claimed that they could locate no records for Mr. Driver. They forwarded the request to the Marines, who administratively closed my request after I did not respond to a denial letter (that I never personally received until after the closure) of my waiver of fees request. This is why I am sending the request directly to this office.

The public interest in Mr. Driver, an Academy Award-nominated film actor , should favor disclosure of many of these records, particularly in relation to any disciplinary records, should those records exist.

Please be sure to review and release any segregable information, even if certain documents or portions of documents are withheld.

PLEASE NOTE: I am not a next of kin of this servicemember, and thus do not know Mr. Driver’s Social Security Number. Because of this, I am ONLY requesting records releasable under the Freedom of Information Act. Please process my request for this servicemember's OMPF and other records under the Freedom of Information Act’s relevant provisions. I am not seeking any records that would be releasable under the Privacy Act.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.communication:
"This is to acknowledge the receipt of your request for records and to let you know that I am the analyst assigned for processing. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me at this email.

Please be aware that, whenever a FOIA requester has not received a determination within 20 working days from the date a request is perfected, they are entitled to challenge the delay. It can be done within the SecureRelease system or by writing to the Department of the Navy, Office of the Judge Advocate General (Code 14), 1322 Patterson Ave SE, Suite 3000, Washington Navy Yard, DC 20374-5066 or, if you prefer, via e-mail to OJAG-C14-FOIA-PA-ADMINAPPEALS@us.navy.mil. Your appeal, if any, should include a statement indicating why you believe it should be granted. It must be postmarked or timestamped within 90 calendar days from the date of this email.


Requesters also have the right to seek assistance and/or dispute resolution services from the Department of the Navy FOIA Public Liaison, Mr. Christopher Julka, at Christopher.a.julka.civ@us.navy.mil or (703) 697-0031, and may also contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) for assistance and/or dispute resolution at ogis@nara.gov or (877) 684-6448.

Thank you for your patience as we work to complete the processing of your request.


V/r,
Ms. Kheli Fortier
FOIA Analyst

Commandant of the Marine Corps (ARSF)
Headquarters US Marine Corps
3000 Marine Corps Pentagon
Washington DC 20350-3000

Direct Line: (571) 256-8636

for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential
and/or privileged information. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure or
distribution is prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please
contact the sender by e-mail and destroy any copies of the original message.

We value your comments please take time complete the Management Comment Card
via the ICE Tool
https://ice.disa.mil/index.cfm?fa=card&service_provider_id=130985&site_id=341&dep=DoD

If you wish to submit a FOIA/PA request to the Marine Corps, please do so via our online portal at www.securerelease.us. This is the fastest and most reliable way to send us your request, and it ensures that all requests are properly and accurately tracked from the date/time of submission."

files.title: RO Referral Letter Occupational Safety & Health
files.source: United States Postal Service, United States of America

communications.subject: FOIA Case No. 2025-FPRO-02594
communications.communication:
This responds to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated June 5, 2025, in which you seek access to Postal Service records. Specifically, your request states:



Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:



* Any current USPS training module, training material or handout for delivery workers concerning bear encounters and bear attacks, and

* The most-recent yearly report describing numbers of attacks on postal workers by wind and/or stray animals that mentions bears, and

* The previous year's edition of that report.



Attached please find a stand-up safety talk regarding bear safety. This talk is available for our field management to use whenever needed.



As to the second and third item in your request, a search was conducted that reveals that there are no records available responsive to your inquiry. The United States Postal Service does not track accidents and/or injuries by specific animal. A keyword search for the word "bear" did not reveal any incidents.



If you are not satisfied with the response to this request, you may file an administrative appeal within ninety (90) days of the date of this response letter by writing to the General Counsel, U.S. Postal Service, 475 L'Enfant Plaza, SW, Washington, DC 20260 or via email at FOIAAppeal@usps.gov. Your appeal must be postmarked or electronically transmitted within ninety (90) days of the date of the response to your request.



The letter of appeal should include, as applicable:

(1) A copy of the request, of any notification of denial or other action, and of any other related correspondence;

(2) The FOIA tracking number assigned to the request;

(3) A statement of the action, or failure to act, from which the appeal is taken;

(4) A statement identifying the specific redactions to responsive records that the requester is challenging;

(5) A statement of the relief sought; and

(6) A statement of the reasons why the requester believes the action or failure to act is erroneous.



For further assistance and to discuss any aspect of your request, you may contact FOIA Public Liaison listed below:

PRIVACY & RECORDS OFFICE US POSTAL SERVICE 475 L'ENFANT PLAZA SW RM 1P830 WASHINGTON DC 20260-1101 Phone: (202) 268-2608 Fax: (202) 268-5353 Email: FOIA12@usps.gov

FOIA Public Liaison: Nancy Chavannes

Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer. The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.

Linda DeCarlo | Sr. Director - Occupational Safety & Health
United States Postal Service | 475 L'Enfant Plaza, SW | Washington, DC  20260
O - (202) 268-3587 | M - (202) 360-9339

Share any file or folder easily, with anyone 
By just sharing a link, you can send anything – from Office Docs and PDFs to 
zipped folders and large CAD files – to anyone, even if they don’t have a 
Dropbox account. Add password protection and expiration dates to ensure only 
the right people see your files.*

Big needs? With Dropbox Transfer, you can send large files up to 100 GB 
without taking up space in your Dropbox account.** 





Learn More 
<https://learn.dropbox.com/self-guided-learning/dropbox-fundamentals-course/how-to-use-dropbox#how-to-share-a-file-or-folder-from-your-dropbox-account>

Share what you want, how you want 
You can save, access, and share your important stuff from anywhere, at any 
time, on any device. 

Start sharing <https://www.dropbox.com/work?file_chooser_type=sharing> 

 <https://www.dropbox.com/work?file_chooser_type=sharing> 



All of your large file transfer needs covered 
Dropbox Transfer lets you send up 100 MB per transfer with your Dropbox Basic 
plan, up to 100 GB with Dropbox Essentials and Dropbox Business and up to 250 
GB with Dropbox Business Plus. Send videos, project files, and track downloads. 

Create a transfer <https://www.dropbox.com/transfer> 

 <https://www.dropbox.com/transfer> 

*Some features require upgrading your account to a paid Dropbox plan.
Learn how and view plans. <https://www.dropbox.com/plans>

information. <https://help.dropbox.com/share/dropbox-transfer>

communications.communication:
Open, edit, make a copy, or share more  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌      Your shared files are here!  Files that were recently shared with you on Dropbox are saved for easy access - open them any time to review. If you have edit access, you can also comment, download, edit, or share again.    Open shared files         Editing PDFs, photos, and videos Edit your newly received files without leaving Dropbox, so they’re always saved. You can reorder, rotate, add text, or highlight text in PDFs without switching between tools. Editing photos, images, and videos is also easy. You can flip, crop, adjust brightness, then rename and move to get organized.   [2] [3] [3]

 <https://www.dropbox.com/> 


File sharing just got an upgrade 

Hi Dhruv, 

Any changes made to a shared file will be automatically updated and synced for 
all recipients. 

Click to view your Dropbox <https://www.dropbox.com/h> 

Give others a preview with view-only access
Want someone to be able to see your files but not be able to edit them? Share 
your content with view-only access.

Collaborate using edit access
Need others to collaborate on content with you? You can give them edit access 
to entire folders or specific files.

Collect content with a File Request
Dropbox's File Request feature lets you easily & securely request files from 
others– whether they have a Dropbox account or not.

Learn more 
<https://help.dropbox.com/guide/individual/how-to-share-files-folders#sharing-with-dropbox>

communications.subject: Have you seen these new features?
communications.communication:

Here's what you're missing at Dropbox 
We've come out with new features to help you organize, find, and do more with 
your digital content. 
Try now <https://www.dropbox.com/automations> 
 <https://www.dropbox.com/automations> 
Just tell us how you want things done and we'll take care of the rest. 

 * Automated folders. Create folders that automatically perform specific 
tasks—such as naming, sorting, tagging, and converting—anytime a file is added 
to the folder. 
 * Automated dashboard. Control and manage automated folders and their 
settings from a central dashboard. 
 * Naming conventions. Create file naming standards based on categories that 
can be applied to individual folders. 
 * Multi-file organize. Categorize and sort a folder’s files into subfolders 
based on dates, keywords or level of activity. Preview and verify changes 
before files are moved. 
Try now <https://www.dropbox.com/automations>

title: California Police and Immigration (San Diego Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting records and data related to Senate Bill 674. The law requires certifying agencies that receive certification requests must annually report to the Legislature the number of victims that requested certifications from the particular agency, the number of certifications signed, and the number of certifications denied. The certifications are for U and T Visas. 

I am requesting 
- The annual reports sent to the legislature as legally required since 2018. 
- Department U visa certification policy and protocols since 2024
- Bulletins, emails, memos, directives, or any communications from DHS and/or United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) regarding SB674 and Form I-914s. Search January 2025 to today's date. 
- Any memos, bulletins, directives, or formal communications regarding U and T Visas. Search from 2020 to today's date. 

Thank you!

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

The certifications are for U and T Visas.

I am requesting

- Bulletins, emails, memos, directives, or any communications from DHS and/or United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) regarding SB674 and Form I-914s. Search January 2025 to today's date.
- Any memos, bulletins, directives, or formal communications regarding U and T Visas. Search from 2020 to today's date.

Thank you!

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Safety National Complaints (Attorney General's Office)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Safety National Complaints (Attorney General's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to all records in your possession from January 1, 2014, through the present concerning complaints, investigations, or regulatory actions involving Safety National Casualty Corporation, including any affiliated entities such as Safety Specialty Insurance Company and Sedgwick Claims Management Services, Inc. 

Specifically, I request copies of all consumer complaints alleging claim denials, delays, bad faith practices, misrepresentation of coverage, or failure to defend or indemnify insureds; any related correspondence or internal assessments; all regulatory enforcement actions, including market conduct examinations, administrative penalties, consent orders, fines, stipulations, or notices of violation; and any internal memoranda, emails, audit findings, or documentation regarding systemic or repeated misconduct. I also seek any statistical reports, dashboards, or complaint trend summaries reflecting activity related to Safety National during this period.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Fecteau

title: Rutgers transgender inmate care

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Rutgers transgender inmate care
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

University Correctional Health Care policy and guidance documents regarding the care and treatment of transgender inmates from the New Jersey Department of Corrections. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: Welcome to the Rutgers University Open Public Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Ileana  Garnand, 
Thank you for registering with Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey Open Public Records Center, an online, public portal. Below you will find your portal login and password information . 
 Login:  186411-52482319@requests.muckrock.com 
 
 If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password, you may request a Temporary Password (https://rutgers.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/forgotpassword.aspx) 
 
If you are a first time user and did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you with the login and password listed above. At this account you can access, track and receive any documents in response to your request. 
Please log in to the Rutgers University Open Public Records Center and then "My Request Center" to update any contact or password information on your account and to view your request. (https://rutgers.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/SupportHome.aspx) 
The University Custodian of Records will contact you if there are questions regarding your request or provide you a response. If you have questions, you may contact the OPRA Administrator at 973.972.8000. 
 
Thank you again for registering with the Rutgers University Open Public Records Center.

communications.subject: Open Public Records Act Request :: R009772-051125
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Garnand: 
Thank you for submitting your request for government records of Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the New Jersey Open Public Records Act (OPRA), NJSA 47:1 et seq. Your request was received through the online, public portal Rutgers University Open Public Records Center of this office on 5/11/2025 and  given the reference number R009772-051125. 

Your request will be forwarded to the Office of the Custodian of Records for review and processing, including determining the volume of responsive documents and any potential costs associated with satisfying your request. Please note, the N.J. Open Public Records Act does not require the University to create new documents, to conduct research, or to answer questions for information. 

Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

University Correctional Health Care policy and guidance documents regarding the care and treatment of transgender inmates from the New Jersey Department of Corrections. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Frutgers-university-15089%252Frutgers-transgender-inmate-care-186411%252F%253Femail%253Dopraru%252540ca.rutgers.edu&url_auth_token=AABDW88zCZQQ8u37A1m4ZNKzzRI%3A1uEIee%3AWhJb-t3JSq_Md-oz2pDgSJdErA3ftpRS1jZbCCv28n0 
The Office of the Custodian of Records uses the Rutgers University Open Public Records Center to communicate with you, respond to and track all open public records requests.  If you have submitted your request electronically through Rutgers Open Public Records Center portal, you have already been required to create an account.

Notice to First Time Portal Users: 
If you are a first time user and did not submit your request through the public portal, you are receiving this request because the Rutgers Office of the Custodian has created an account for you at the Rutgers University Open Public Records Center . 
To access your account and view your request: 

1.Go to: 2. Select/open  "My Records Center" Rutgers University Open Public Records Center. 
3. Enter your email and password as provided in your previously received Welcome Letter. 

You can monitor your request through the Rutgers University Open Public Records Center at "My Request Center." 
Thank you and if you have questions, you  may contact the OPRA Administrator at (973) 972-1981.

Newark, New Jersey 07101-1709

title: Sex Offender Registry and Information on Community Supervision Request

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Sex Offender Registry and Information on Community Supervision Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The exact number of people who are 

1) on both the sex offender registry and probation; and
2) on both the sex offender registry and parole;

as per the latest available data is requested.

If this cannot be provided, I request records that include:

The list of people on probation
The list of people on parole
The list of people on the sex offender registry

as per the latest available data. 

If this data is held by another agency, I request the name of that agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

communications.subject: RE: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Sex Offender Registry and Information on Community Supervision Request
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Your request was received and is being processed. Your request was submitted after business hours on June 5, 2025 and received by the Department the following business day, June 6, 2025. The Department has five business days upon receipt of a request to issue a response. Pursuant to KRS 197.025, KRS 61.870 to 61.884 to the contrary notwithstanding, , the department shall respond to the request within five (5) days after receipt of the request, excepting Saturdays, Sundays, and legal holidays, and state whether the record may be inspected or may not be inspected, or that the record is unavailable and when the record is expected to be available.

Thank you,

Keesha Solomon
Open Records Coordinator | Division of Public Affairs
Kentucky Department of Corrections

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III." 

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Rock

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129
Santa Fe, New Mexico 87502

(505) 827-8030 fax

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Nov. 6, 2023. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Please see the attached concerning your request to inspect public records with the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board.

Thank you.

Amanda Olsen




[cid:image001.png@01DA1096.4DDD2B90]

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

files.title: image002
files.source: New Mexico Educational Retirement Board, New Mexico

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hi,

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it.

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Renee,

Thank you for your continued partnership on this request. Please know that we are unable to access the SharePoint link you had provided. Our email address is not showing as associated with the link: 147140-15493170@requests.muckrock.com.

Please advise at your earliest convenience.

Thank You,

MuckRock Staff

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

We apologize for the error you received while trying to access the records. We will be using another method for delivery. Attached are the instructions that you will need to connect to the ERB SFTP server.  I will send you the credentials in a secure email to follow this.

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records. We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024. Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA2C20.B2CBD790]

title: bodycam footages

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: bodycam footages
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

body cam footages for the following case
Full Name: Ann Marie Farone
Date: 12/27/2023
Birthdate: 04/21/1985

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Martin Brooks

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: bodycam footages
communications.communication:

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: bodycam footages
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,
I have received your request for the body cam footage on Anna Marie Farone.
Unfortunately, I cannot send this to you via email.
If you can please send a check made out to the Austintown Police Department it is $10 for a flash drive and also a self-addressed envelope with the proper mailing charge to send it back to you.
Thank you,

files.title: ~WRD0000
files.source: Police Department , Austintown Ohio, Austintown, OH

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: bodycam footages
communications.communication:
Hi, 

Thank you for your help with this request. We can definitely send a check. Could you confirm the following address is a good place to send the check?

92 Ohltown Road, Austintown, OH 44515

Thanks!

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: bodycam footages
communications.communication: Yes, that is the correct address.

files.title: ~WRD0004
files.source: Police Department , Austintown Ohio, Austintown, OH

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: bodycam footages
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please find enclosed a check for $10.00 to satisfy the fee associated with the attached public records request.

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: bodycam footages
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please know we have started processing a check for this request fee. A check will be sent out within the next couple of days to Austintown Police, 92 Ohltown Road, Austintown, OH 44515.

Thank you.

communications.subject: Body Cam Request
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,
I have received the check for $10 to cover the flash drive for the requested body cam footage.
Unfortunately, I did not receive a self-addressed envelope with the postage to cover the funds to send the flash drive to you.
It looks like you are located in Massachusetts so it should only be a couple dollars but I do need you to send an envelope with the postage so I can send it over to you.
Thank you,


Samantha Skully
Austintown Police Department
Records Clerk
(330)270-5103
92 Ohltown Rd
Austintown, Ohio 44515

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: bodycam footages
communications.communication:
Hello Samantha,

Thank you for your continued support on this request. Please know that it is not possible for us to send a SASE to your agency at this time. Can you please send an invoice for the amount required for you to fulfill this request that includes postage and handling? We can then send another check to you for that additional amount as you have already received the check for $10.00.

Best Regards,

 MuckRock Staff

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: bodycam footages
communications.communication:
Hello good morning,
I have attached an invoice above for the total of postage it would be to send the flash drive.
Thank you & have a great day.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

A flash drive was sent last Friday, June 6th to:
Muckrock News
DEPT MR 184329
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115
Please let me know when you have received it.
Thank you & have a great day.

title: ROTC Documents

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: ROTC Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The senior commissioned officer of the armed force who is assigned to each ROTC Program with the rank of Professor at VMI.
2. VMI's agreement with the Secretary of each military department for which it has an ROTC Program.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Request for Body Camera Footage and Incident Records – Feb 2, 2025 I-35 Chase (Bell County & Troy PD) (Lorena Police Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Body Camera Footage and Incident Records – Feb 2, 2025 I-35 Chase (Bell County & Troy PD) (Lorena Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the high-speed pursuit and arrests that occurred on February 2, 2025, beginning around 12:30 a.m. on Interstate 35 near the 310-mile marker in Troy, Texas. The incident involved two four-door vehicles reportedly traveling at 108 MPH. The first vehicle attempted to exit and re-enter the highway multiple times, then tried to drive northbound in the southbound lanes near Industrial Boulevard in Temple. Troy Police reportedly forced the vehicle off the road, and three suspects were arrested after a foot pursuit. Weapons and drugs were reportedly recovered.

Please include:

Body camera footage from Troy PD, Bell County SO, Temple PD, and Lorena PD

Dashcam video from all police units involved in the pursuit and apprehension

911 call audio and radio dispatch logs from the incident

Incident and arrest reports, including affidavits, if available

Any photos, drone, or scene video footage

Any use of force documentation (if applicable)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani
